definition: to cling to the powerful and rich (idiom); social climbing

sentences.english: Such things can never make my heart rejoice.
sentences.chinese: 安能摧眉折腰事權貴，使我不得開心顏。

sentences.english: With him went the noble levy and the private magnate armies.
sentences.chinese: 徵募的貴族民團和權貴的私軍與他同行。

sentences.english: The Viscount d'Epinoy was the first of several dignitaries to take up the savage girl's cause.
sentences.chinese: 德埃皮努瓦子爵是最早收養這個野女孩的權貴之一。

sentences.english: That the influential official also certainly has many person is good , breast is such as magnanimous.
sentences.chinese: 當然權貴也有很多人是不錯的，諸如胸懷坦蕩的。

sentences.english: Can we at least change the country's name to the United States of Klepto-Plutocrats ?
sentences.chinese: 我們能不能至少把國名改成”美利堅權貴竊國“？

sentences.english: Continued economic problems may intensify resentment of the Beltway fat cats.
sentences.chinese: 存留的經濟問題或可加劇華府政治權貴對他的嫌怨。

sentences.english: Flattering words are welcomed while advice or criticism will offend those rich and powerful people.
sentences.chinese: 好話總是令人歡喜，諷諫總會得罪權貴。

sentences.english: Crony capitalism, on both sides of the Pacific, it appears, has its rewards.
sentences.chinese: 看來，權貴資本主義在太平洋兩岸都是如魚得水。

sentences.english: The powerful father puts Liu in prison for robbing.
sentences.chinese: 她的權貴父親將柳夢梅以入室盜竊之罪名打入官牢。

definition: frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
